Description: Bowl and flaring stem sherd of Chian pottery stemmed dish; glaze fired orange; white slip; interior, at centre of bowl, rosette with added red dots on petals, around red-dotted disc and three rings; exterior: reserved inside stem; outside of stem reserved save for band at join with bowl and two bands on mid wall.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Schaus, G. 'The East Greek, Island, and Laconian Pottery', in G. Schaus, The Extramural Sanctuary of Demeter at Cyrene, Libya Final Reports II. Philadelphia 1985, 83, no. 517.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2154) (phase 2)
